conclusion: Need to calculate average velocity and average speed of particle moving along semi-circular arcs.
Identify given values: Radius of each semi-circle is 1m, Time taken is 5s.
Calculate distance traveled by particle along each semi-circle: Distance d1 = 2m, Distance d2 = 2m.
Calculate average velocity: Average velocity v = Distance/Time = 2/5 = 0.4 m/s.
Calculate average speed incorrectly: Average speed v = Distance x Time = 2 x 5 = 10 m/s.
Total distance traveled is 2 x 2 = 4 m.
Calculate average speed correctly: Average speed v = Total Distance/Time = 4/5 = 0.8 m/s.
Compare average velocity and average speed: Average velocity is 0.4 m/s, Average speed is 0.8 m/s.
Determine which is greater: Average speed 0.8 m/s is greater than average velocity 0.4 m/s.
Final answer: Average speed of particle is 0.8 m/s.
Step-by-step answer: Average velocity is 0.4 m/s, average speed is 10 m/s.
